Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Turn

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Turn
public class Turn
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents a single turn in the match. It is implemented with a state pattern. On initialization it must be bound to a specific player.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    (package private) static class  Turn.VictoryConditions
    Anonymous class to represent the win, lose or neutral conditions of the turn

  • Constructor Details

    • Turn

      public Turn​(Game game, Player player)
      Builder of the turn. It binds to a specific game and player. It initializes all the relevant structures and sets the first state, then calling .setup() on it to decide the first actual turn.
      Parameters:
      game - the game associated to the turn
      player - the player performing actions in the turn

      public void changeState()
      Sets current state to next state Doing this it also resets all the structures representing the state of the turn, including targetCells, skippable and allowedWorkers

      public boolean canMoveTo​(Worker pawn, Cell targetCell)
      This boolean methods checks if the pawn can move to targetCell
      Parameters:
      pawn - the worker we want to move
      targetCell - the cell we want to move the worker to
      Returns:
      if the pawn can move to targetCell

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo​(Worker pawn, Cell targetCell) throws InvalidTurnStateException
      This method moves the pawn to targetCell
      Parameters:
      pawn - the worker we want to move
      targetCell - the cell we want to move the worker to
      Throws:
      InvalidTurnStateException - if in the wrong state

    • canBuildDomeIn

      public boolean canBuildDomeIn​(Worker pawn, Cell targetCell)
      This boolean methods checks if the pawn can build a Dome in targetCell
      Parameters:
      pawn - the worker who performs the build
      targetCell - the cell involved in the build
      Returns:
      true if the pawn can build dome in targetCell

    • buildDomeIn

      public void buildDomeIn​(Worker pawn, Cell targetCell) throws InvalidTurnStateException
      This methods builds a dome in targetCell
      Parameters:
      pawn - the worker who performs the build
      targetCell - the cell involved in the build
      Throws:
      InvalidTurnStateException - if in the wrong state

    • canBuildBlockIn

      public boolean canBuildBlockIn​(Worker pawn, Cell targetCell)
      This boolean methods checks if the pawn can build a block in targetCell
      Parameters:

      targetCell - the cell involved in the build
      Returns:
      true if the pawn can build a block in targetCell

    • buildBlockIn

      public void buildBlockIn​(Worker pawn, Cell targetCell) throws InvalidTurnStateException
      This methods builds a block in targetCell
      Parameters:
      pawn - the worker who performs the build
      targetCell - the cell involved in the build
      Throws:
      InvalidTurnStateException - if in the wrong state

    • draw

      public void draw()
      This method lets the player surrender. It doesn't call changeState and goes directly to Lose to avoid computing winConditions
